newsitem.title: USA: Ballot questions and bond referendums by state.
newsitem.headline: Ballot questions and bond referendums by state.

text.p: The following is a list of upcoming ballot initiatives and measures affecting municipal finance.
P - passed. D - defeated. NA - not available.
CALIFORNIA
June 3
--Two tax ballot issues to raise $60 million in Los Angeles County.
FLORIDA
June 10
--Marion County, half-cent sales tax increase for schools.
June 17
--Oglethorpe County, five-year extension of special purpose one-cent sales tax increase.
Nov 4
--Up to $800 million of Broward County general obligation bonds for schools.
LOUISIANA
July 19
--Lafayette City-Parish votes on $222 million of capital improvement bonds for streets, drainage and recreation.
MISSISSIPPI
May 6
--Pass Christian votes on $10.1 million GO bonds for schools.
NEW JERSEY

--Northern Highlands Regional High School District, N.J., votes on three separate ballot questions: a $1.62 million bond issue for computers and technology improvements; a $395,600 bond for an all-weather track and auditorium upgrades; and a $636,600 bond for gym improvements and other upgrades.
--Palmyra, N.J., votes on tax increase to fund $99,500 of additional school budget items.

--Perth Amboy, N.J., voters decide whether to raise taxes to support an $81.1 million school budget.
--Shamong, N.J., votes on tax increase to fund $374,092 of additional school budget items.
P --Somerville, N.J., votes on spending $952,000 of additional school budget funds for sports and other programs.
P --South Harrison, N.J., votes on $260,000 of additional school budget items.
D --Spotswood, N.J., votes on $148,000 in additional school budget spending.
--Tabernacle, N.J., votes on $370,397 of additional school budget items.
D --Vorhees, N.J., votes decide whether to approve a $30.6 million Board of Education budget that would raise the school tax rated 15.5 cents per $100 of assessed value.
D --Washington Township, N.J., votes on tax increase to fund $2.5 million of additional budget items.
--Waterford, N.J., votes on $654,344 of additional school budget items.

P --Woodbury, N.J., voters decide two questions: whether to raise taxes by $6.4 million to support the regular budget for fiscal 1998, and whether to raise taxes an additional $208,391 to maintain moderate class sizes and five elementary school teaching positions.
May 6
--$6.6 million Caldwell School District, N.J., school general obligation bonds, for school renovations and technology improvements.
